abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Southern Kassala Agricultural Project
            (SKAP) in Sudan. The two major objectives were: (i) to
            increase production on a sustainable basis; and (ii) to
            improve environmental management.  Bank's performance
            was satisfactory. Borrower's performance was
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            the availability of government funds was essential for the
            continuation of the project after the suspension of all
            credit disbursements to Sudan; (ii) it would have been more
            effective for the Project Management Unit (PMU) to directly
            contract water and road works; (iii) it is very important
            that these kind of studies are carried out at the very early
            stage of a project and it is the GOS view that such an
            exercise should be standard practice in area development
            projects; (iv) the satisfactory performance of the project
            was largely due to the simplicity of design and a rational
            prioritization of objectives which would have been
            achievable had the project financing continued as planned;
            (v) the necessary reformulation of the project helped to
            develop a low cost option and objectives and expenditure
            were carefully matched; (vi) construction of hafirs should
            be considered for manual work in view of labor’s
            competitiveness to machinery; and (vii) tax collection for
            road construction from benefitting farmers appears
            acceptable in the State of Gedaref
